values:
Sorry I haven't posted in soooo long, been about a month now!  EDIT: noticed after I posted it is almost exactly 1 month to the minute since my last post!  Wow!  I will describe simply some things I did in August and early September and will post fully on them bit by bit soon!

% 2 x trips to Edinburgh for the Fringe Festival, one of 2 nights with my sis and the other 3 nights alone.  The legendary Jim Bowen being just one of dozens of shows I saw!

% 2 x trips to ChillFactorE, Trafford's new indoor snow centre.  Have now lost both my snowboarding and skiing virginities!

% Cinema: Wall-E (astonishing levels of genius demonstrated here), Dark Knight IMAX (CONTROVERSY ALERT! not keen!)

% Play: Enjoy! penned by the excellent Alan Bennett, @ The Lowry - fantastic

% Manchester Pride (4 days): Most fun yet by far!

% Beached! festival weekend - York and Scarborough fun with Ruth, Amy, Karl and Emma

% Southport day out including NATIONAL LAWNMOWER MUSEUM

% RuDa Olympiad

% Tourist day here in the Chester of Man with Dad

% My 13 week marriage to Mr. Big.  Brother.

On Tues I went to Sheffield for a random day out.  It was great:

- Vivienne Westwood exhibition - her life's work, very interesting
- Space Age exhibition
- Trams are so modern and go down HILLS into UNDERGROUND TUNNELS
- Park Hill flats - always forget how I love this brutalist masterpiece
- Green space - a lot of it
- Excellent thoroughfare from station into town, very well designed.  Some good town planning in this country for once!
- I now like this city a lot, it has grown on me!

I'll start with last weekend, camping in north Wales with Ruth.  This was really cool despite initially being a bit sad we weren't going to Conwy as I'd thought!  We stayed near Mold, and it was a nicer area than it sounds!  Only about 25 miles from the Wirral!  The campsite was on a farm and was a lovely location with great  views of the hills!  Highlights of the weekend were:

- Discovering a Catholic pilgrimage site in the town of Holywell (a Holy Well, predictably!) with a ridiculous legend (St. Winefride, look it up!) and people taking the waters entirely seriously.  We had audio guides, with the equipment supplied being surely the greatest thing for the task, REAL AUTHENTIC SONY WALKMEN!  
- A PET CEMETARY!  Oh yes!  Complete with cafe where we had delicious home made orange and lemon cake, surrounded by bouncing LIVE mini dogs, choice of caskets and huge landscaped grounds!
- Picnics.  Ruth did a great job, tuna tomatoey wraps and cheese and onion rolls, PUFFINS de Asda, couse cous, strange beans pretending to be Eastern!
- Chester.  Really good to see the place packed and had a great atmosphere.

This week had 1 night doing Ancoats pubs with Chris, this was impromptu (rare for me not to plan something!) which was fab discovered some gems!  Another night was spent on Beech Rd, the hippyish enclave of Chorlton and dining at the fabulous Marmalade with friends I used to work with at Pipex, great to catch up.  Wednesday I went to Lancaster and met parents there, we saw Beauty and the Beast performed al fresco in Williamson Park.  I'd always wanted to see one of these famour productions, and it was fantastic.  Very clever how each scene was in a different bit of the park, with completely different atmosphere in each bit!  Gorgeous views of Morecambe Bay too as it was a nice day!  Had tea at the Merchants pub before, was weird to be back there and we sat in the same area as at graduation!

The past 2 days I've had a lovely time home alone really chilling, catching up with TV (box still 95% full though!), an interview with Liz Smith (granny from Royle Family amongst other appearences) being just 1 highlight.  Have also been catching up on the net, reading blogs and sites, don't do that much nowadays!  Have finally sorted my iPod out so I can use it properly again and done some housework so feel quite productive!

Going to Blackburn tomorrow for my nephew's 4th birthday - can't wait, have not seen him in a while!

Deb is dead right it's a shame LJ has been rendered semi-defunct by the admittedly wondorous but somehow less personal Facebook!  I've been meaning to update in ages but I think I'd become de-motivated due to the general lack of updates!  Well not any more!

Have loved being off work the past 2.5 months, doing all kinds of fun things!  Have taken a few long trips through the Peak District to Belper and stayed in Het's lovely old cottage.  These trips usually involve cool pubs, nice eating out, fajitas (atrociously, I never make these any more myself!), trips to Derby and general laid-back hanging out.  2 weeks ago we sampled the best cinema I've ever visited, the Showcase De Lux in Derby - lovely trees with fairy lights in the foyer!  

Have had 7 theme park trips this year, including 4 in the past month or so!  Went to Thorpe Park just south of London for the first time with Wardy a friend from Pipex.  Was a great trip, got a cheap London Travelodge.  Met Deb, Lou, Shazia and her boyfriend for an afternoon in a park where we gossiped and drank coconuts filled with rum and milk!  Then went to Soho with Wardy sat out and people watched all evening, fab!  Don't know why haven't done that before!  

Thorpe is a great park with a large selection of big rides, much more modern and numerous than Alton Towers with just as nice a country setting.  In addition, huge lakes surround the place.  However was busier than expected so lots of queuing still I didn't mind was fun to go with Wardy!

Also been to Blackpool, Drayton Manor Park and Alton Towers lately.  So am feeling very theme parked up which is good!

Also been to Liverpool lots to see Ruth, have visited different attractions each time in the day then met her in the eve.  Williamson Tunnels very interesting underground folly tunnels.  

Family are doing OK but my Grandad died last week so was his funeral this week which was sad but I was less nervous about it after going to my first one, my Grandma's in December.  

Saw Kung Fu Panda this week which was surprisingly good, love it when that happens!  

Off to Conwy and Llandudno with Ruth this weekend, camping in Wales so that will be really good, we' ve been meaning to do it for ages.  I went there for new year's eve, Conwy is a beautiful walled town that's part historic walled town, harbour and surrouded by mountains it's ace!

Well my last post was just under a month ago and that only went up until the 7th April and I've been meaning to post ever since!  I finished work on 13 May so have been enjoying the freedom from tedius spreadsheets and marathon bus journeys ever since!  

Haven't been keeping a simple log of my activities so I'll have to just loosely remember what I've done!

12 April - Alton Towers, last minute day out with Adam and about 8 people from his billing team.  Ace day queues were quite short which was good and the weather was insane, a right mix of hail, freezingness, sun, rain, everything!  Made the rides more extreme so I was loving it!  

Saw Happy Go Lucky in April for free at Didsbury cinema, was really great, a fantastic feel good film but really well done, not cheesy but the main woman playing the character was really good.  Surprised at just how genius it was and great to know there are people out there who remain genuinely happy and jolly whatever life throws at them!

Was my Dad's 70th (!) birthday on 19 April so went to Blackburn for a family meal at a new restaurant it was very swish and fun!

Well I'm getting a bit behind with these updates, but do not worry, I am compiling a list of what I need to write about!  So soon there will be updates on:

Trip to Prague
Trip to London and Spice Girls!
Trip to Edinburgh (4 months ago!)
theatre
work
music

At the moment I am very thrilled to only have 1.25 days of work to go then I'm OFF until Jan 2nd-woooooooop!!!!!  I'm so sick of having to get up at 6:50am and leave at 7:35 to get to work for 9 and fill in spreadsheets all day!  Will be heavenly to lie-in and catch up with family and my PVR which is coming home with me - can finally finish Heroes etc!  Been so busy lately and work is now hard as I'm on various warnings and probation extensions so HAVE to be here on time and do ALL the work every day.  Don't sit near anyone chatty so hardly talk either, grrrr!  It's still an amazingly relaxed place to work though!  

Met Ruth in War Town last night (Warrington as it's commonly known) randomly as it wasn't too far for either of us.  Ended up at Lloyd's as there's nowhere to eat, just like Blackburn!  Was really nice anyway!

My Grandma is in hospital with pneumonia :-( and isn't too good.  Went home on Tues to see her for the evening and she was the worst I've seen her.  However my Mum now says she is steadily getting better.  It is 50/50 at the moment, so keeping our fingers crossed.

The Spice Girls on Sun was a lot of fun, glad they did album tracks The Lady Is A Vamp and If You Can't Dance too!  Posh's strut on the catwalk to an 80's track was LEGENDARY and was pleased to see everyone loves her!  

Off to Christmas markets tonight, tomorrow hopefully a NIGHT IN!

I just received my first ever iPod!  My Dad will be pleased now as I have a fix for my poorly eye :-P Anyway it's a black 80Gb model and I'm very excited to try it out!  Finally gave in and bought something expensive!

Had a busy week or so, went to IKEA last night with Chris which was a lot of fun, had chilli in restaurant and then a good look round the store!  Disappointed the food shop had run out of Pytti y Panna, the YUMMIEST ready meal to ever have existed - little cubes of chicken, potato, veg in spicy tomato sauce!  A really fun night I love how IKEA turn ordinary products into theatre!  I bought a doggy bowl too to use for cereal!

Night before had a night in.  Had a good weekend, Friday stayed in then Saturday cleaned the house ready for parents' arrival at 4pm.  Was cool they came to Manc as they don't come often - Mum hadn't been for over a year!  They arrived and we had some brews then headed out.  I met Chris at new restuarant Giraffe in Spinningfields, had 50% off vouchers, handy as you can;t use Hi Life at weekends.  Had yum meal there it was busy but very nice and very good service.  Next headed to The King's Arms pub in Salford where we saw some fringe theatre - been wanting to attend this interesting venue for a while!  It was a play called "Beautiful House" and was excellent, about a Mum trying to get one up on her daughter's looney boyfriend by giving her her house and moving into a flat.  Lots of class, social themes, really good and funny and fab.  Great theatre, above a Victorian pub, no wonder this place has won loads of awards.  Best pub in Manchester by far.  Ric and Rach you would LOVE it.  

Next met parents, Auntie Brenda (was having a family reunion for her 80th), cousins Jane and John and their partners.  Hardly ever see any of these so was good to catch up in the foyer of the Radisson Edwardian hotel (former free trade hall) where they were all staying.  Very posh but freezing cold with air con and hilarious scenes of drunken randoms throwing themselves through the foyer!  Sven Goran-Ericcson was there and my Dad kept talking to him lol!  Everyone was really drunk apart from me and Mum and so many random chats ensued.  Stayed there til nearly 2am!  

Sunday had breakfast with parents, again at Giraffe!  Were going to attend the Christmas markets well we did for a bit but rain was so bad we decided to go home so I went to Blackburn in car with them, going the Bury/M66 way - great countryside.  Took Dad ages, classic line on motorway "I'm going at 50 and making good progress", er, yes Dad!  I'd got tickets to Girls Aloud before we left Manc, went to arena in person.  Going with Hetty on 31 May!  Can't wait!  

Had nice day/eve at home watching antiques roadshow etc!

Firstly a big WOO HOO to Debbie for finally breaking the lure of evil Facebook!  And with a very interesting and entertaining post I must say!  COME ON EVERYONE ELSE!

Right I know I haven't updated for a month so I'm going to have to do this in stages!  First post I'm going to talk about all the films I've seen lately!

CINEMA:

The Darjeeling Ltd (FREE!) on my Bill (Blackburn speak for "on my own")

Not as good as I'd hoped, lots of pointless drug taking and just not very funny.  I think I just don't totally get Wes Anderson's humour although I prefer The Life Aquatic to this.  

Stardust (FREE!) with Chris

POO, A LOAD OF CRAP!  I'd got it in my head this may be like a noughties Labyrinth - how wrong could I be!  DREADFUL TRITE TOSH, almost unwatchable. Torturously loud sound effects and too many SFX.

Sicko (Michael Moore's latest), 2-4-1 with Chris

BRILLIANT!  One of the best films this year.  Really interesting, I'm very pro-public healthcare as my Mum has worked for the NHS all her life and I did have an idea of US healthcare from relatives who live there etc.  It's just so awful, the scandalous way the companies operate and the idea of having to consider money when you're carted off in an ambulance.  It really makes my blood boil all the anti-NHS stuff in our media, obviously it's far from perfect but it's way prefereable to it not exisiting and I for one am proud we have it!  

Into The Wild, 2-4-1 with Chris

Pretty good but not amazing, it dragged a little in parts, I'd maybe have cut a few scenes shorter.  Interesting to see the consequences of going on a random trip.  It's based on a true story of a guy who gave up his material life to go and live in Alaska and fend for himself with nature etc (Ruth will be getting excited now), killing animals, meeting randoms and living with nature.  Definately worth a watch.

Going round to Hannah's tonight (used to work with at Edexcel) so that will be fun!
For the 1st time ever, my friends page says that!  Come on people!

Just about to finish work (at 4pm, oh yeh, I got an 8-4) and go to LIVERPOOL for Ruth's bday celebration weekend!  Then on Sunday morning going to meet Hetty at Cheshire Oaks - not seen her for 2 months and not been CO in aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaages!  Then after going to BBurn and my Auntie Brenda and Cousin Julie (from USA!) are here visiting!  Yay!

Mon 8th

Went with Chris to Chaophraya thai restaurant just off Cross St.  I'd been once before but had forgotten how AMAZING it is.  That time I didn't have Hi Life but now I do.  Had amazing chicken, lemongrass etc main course.  A thai pancake which was green, with amazing coconut ice cream.  We also got coconut rice wrapped in a banana leaf with main courses which was yum.  This place though, has THE BEST levels of service EVER!  The waiters are amazing, even when I went tut' loo 2 people directed me!  You feel so special and it's so chilled out!  It's amazing!

After headed to Royal Exchange to watch the play of Henry V.  HATED IT.  3+hours long, very heavy and hard going, boring, was soooo tired and it was torturous.  Was with Chris, Cole from work, her boyfriend and friend.

Sat 29

Met Shazia and her boyfriend who had come to stay for weekend at the Cornerhouse.  We had a nice drink there then went to the Green Room, a theatre/arts venue on Whitworth St West.  It was "Emergency 07", a whole free day of short 20-min theatre/dance/anything goes performing arts pieces.  We watched a tortured emo clown mime which was AWFUL, we got fits of giggles and we just couldn't help it it was so ridiculous and pathetic!  After that we indulged in some street pole dancing which was BRILLIANT fun!  About 12 of us went round with these 2 guides and used any bus stop, bicycle rack etc to spin round, jump over/off etc!  Ace fun and we all clapped the others in the group as we did it so there was a great sense of togetherness!  

Next headed to the Opera House to watch South Pacific with Cole, a girl from work, and her boyfriend.  It was OK but wasn't overly thrilled.

Sun 30

Went to bingo at Belle Vue with Shazia and her boyfriend to play for free - none of us won.  In the interval we played on the playground in a park opposite - v fun!  After we headed to Stockport to go to the Toby Carvery I went to with Ruth once - stuffed ourselves with yumminess!  Got home about 6 or so.

Mon 1

Went to see "And When Did You Last See Your Father" at Didsbury cinema for free with Jaz and Izy from work.  Was pretty plodding but v fun as Jaz and Izy talked all the way through which I'm sure was annoying a lot of people but it made it much more entertaining for me!  I'd been to Tesco outside before and got 3 bags of stuff - they said they thought I was going to get a camping stove out!  After Izy gave me a lift home so that was good - about 1/4 the time buses would have taken!

Headed home on Sat 22nd.  Got there about 5pm and had tea at home with parents and watched TV!  Sun I went to see Grandma and Grandad which was cool.  In evening we went to the Auberge my parents fave oddball eaterie in the wilds of Rishton which was an experience as usual!  That night watched more TV and I came back to Manc Monday morning, getting to work earliest ever (lol, the irony, when I have to come 30+ miles I arrive earlier!).

Tue 24th

Went to the Cornerhouse and watched a compilation of student films from 70 years of uni film school history.  Was pretty boring.  

Wed 25th

Had random wander in town, along the river Irwell on the Salford side.  Was really cool as had never walked along there before.  Very quiet and peaceful.  Sat and ate sandwich.  Walked more and ended up going along by the new Spinningfields restaurants.  TBC...

Well sadly Alex moved out last week so I've been feeling all lonely on my own.  However, CHRIS is moving to Manchester!  He's moving in with me this Saturday!  And we're going to look at flats in town, e.g. northern quarter as they're only a teeny bit more expensive per month than where I am now!  Woooooo!  Well excited about everything at the mo, will be fab getting to see Chris lots instead of once in a blue moon!

Going to go back in time with the updates now!  Try and catch up!

Tue 11 Sept

Went to Liverpool for the eve.  Got to Ruth's at 7 and had tea there, with her friend Gorgina from work and flatmate Nicole.  V fun.  Headed to Academy 2, behind the imposing 1930s ODEON, to see Unklejam.  This band are like a cross between Prince, Kelis and Outkast.  V fun, funky songs.  We all loved it and had a great night!  Good to get Ruth away from the EMO torture she puts herself through, if just for 1 night! :-P  Gorgina is really fun and very Lankyshur!  

Thu 13 Sept

Went to Bolton on own after work to visit the Octagon theatre.  They put on 3 plays that had been in the Manchester 24/7 theatre festival in July.  Each play was just 1 hour and 2 of them were really good.  1 was an excellent Abigail's Party clone with a good twist.   1 was set on the tube and the train has a power cut and there's 2 strangers in a carraige and it was about how the react with each other etc.  Very funny and genius.  Turns out they've slept together at a party, in fact just that night, but got drunk and couldn't remember!  The other 1 I can't remember, it wasn't very good.  So a very enjoyable evening but sad to see the lovely 1930s ODEON half demolished and looking like something from Terminator :-(

Back to work more updates later!

TV has suddenly got really good again after a bit of time in the wilderness!

Channel 4's 25th birthday is next month and More4 are currently running some good stuff to celebrate.  On Sunday at 10pm there was a BRILLIANT docu for 2 hours covering the entire history.  All the controversies and ground breaking stuff was covered - The Tube, The Word, The Big Breakfast, Queer As Folk, as well as a lot of the less well known stuff.  The launch was covered too, along with the birth of Film on 4, which really has contributed loads to the British film industry.  Such a brilliant pioneering force in the media - I love c4.  All very geeky and fascinating.  It was a very well produced and researched programme full of fascinating insights.  Don't miss it if it gets repeated!

Charlie Brooker's Screen Wipe is back on BBC4.  First shown every Tuesday at 10pm, with lots of repeats.  He is a columnist in the Guardian and is very acerbic, witty, darkly comic, in short, rather genius.  He analyses TV from a very post-modern angle and looks at how it's produced, how programme makers love to burn money, why things are as they are etc.  Completely different to any other TV reviewer, it is fantastically biting and hilarious.  A must watch if you love subversive humour.

Richard Branson "launched" his "new" channel last night, Virgin 1, effectively just a rebrand of the always somewhat geekily named FTN (Flextech Network - Flextech was the old TV company owned by cable operator Telewest).  It's ch20 on Freeview.  The Riches was on it, which is Eddie Izzard's new US series, drama/comedy.  I recorded it and am looking forward to watching as it sounds interesting as he's part of a travelling family who "steal" the American dream!

Last night More 4 showed the 1st ever episodes of Brookside and Countdown, along with some other early stuff.  Was fun to see both!  

Watched a Nick Broomfield docu, "Tracking Down Maggie" the other night.  This was excellent, he's a great film maker.  He was trying to interview Margaret Thatcher and chasing her round America.

Tonight, Stephen Fry and HIV looks to be excellent, I've been looking forward to it for quite a while.  He is going to talk about his personal experiences and interview various people.  I love his docu style.  

Billie Piper is in a new series, Diary of a Call Girl.  This has had lukewarm reviews but I thought it was very good, she's a great actress and the programme was fun!  Looking forward to the next one.

Around 5 Sept I went to Trafford Centre and saw the stunning new extension to the Orient, the Grand Hall.  It thrilled me lots because I didn't think it was possible for the place to get more ostentatious.  Sheer mental brilliance, so much chintz crammed into such a small space!  Huge chandelier etc!  I sat overlooking it in a nice quiet area of tables eating my McDonald's chicken strips!

Also the Barton Square development over the road looks thrilling it's based on an Italian piazza and will have a massive clock tower (already built) you'll be able to walk up and admire views from!  

That Friday Ruth came up and we went and watched 1 of my workmate's bands at the Castle pub on Oldham St.  Very cool old skool pub with ceilings falling apart etc.  The band was NUTS it was him singing songs about all kinds of weird things "Up the shitter, up the shitter, up the Gary Gary Glitter!" and his girlfriend wearing a big hand made warewolf mask going up to the crowd and hugging them with flailing arms.  Very surreal.  She then got out a load more animal masks and proceeded to put them on people.

Sat we went on a BRILLIANT 20th Century architecture tour in the city centre as part of national heritage open weekend.  Fascinating, learnt so much!  Coevered co-op land, arndale, piccadilly, salford etc!  Next we watched the disappointing art car parade - not long enough but 1 good 1 in the shape of a big set of office desks.

Next on to Gorton Monastery.  Interesting to see but surprisingly bland boring interior apart from the alter which was all old and peeling and with huge crucifix!  

Next I went to Brooklands in Sale to go to Marcus' housewarming.  This was fun and very random, a right bunch of odd balls there including babies, Trisha contestants etc.  Started off odd and felt a bit awkward but the punch started flowing and we all ended up hitting a balloon around like idiots and Marcus got angry and stormed off to the kitchen for most of the night when one of the guests made a passing comment about his music taste!  Was fun with some random banter and good to hang out with a load of strangers!

Sun it was up early for ALTON TOWERS!  Oh yes!  Ruth very kindly made this a fab day for me and despite her many protests, think she secretly loved it!  She went on all the rides bar Nemesis and spinny ones.  She was pretty terrified with Air and Rita but managed to brave the pain!  The queues were very short for most things so we got on everything.  Air is SO TAME though, OMG I actually think it's a bit crap now.  Faves are Oblivion, Hex and Nemesis.  I gave her all the obligatory historical facts.  The grounds of the place are SO beautiful - stunning views from all the rides and the car journey was lovely I always forget how amazing it is.  What made it even better was we didn't use a single motorway, instead we went through Stockport, Macclesfield and Leek and there was no traffic.  Lovely.  For lunch we had pizza hut which we hadn't had in ages so that was good!  At the end of the day had a minor monorail altercation - just about got on the last 1 of the day with some random bling-loving Londoners with disabled kids.  Well they loved to milk the fact and were going on about the trauma of being stuck in a monorail for a bit.  Yes it was annoying but they went a bit OTT!  What a great day though!

Didn't do much this week main thing was going to see Superbad with Liz from work on the Thurs - it was surprisingly good and I've just discovered the man whose writing the "new wave" of teen comedies also wrote Freaks and Geeks (check it out people - AMAZINGLY good teen drama show from the US from 1999).  Naturally, it was free, but this time at the Red Cinema, opposite the Man Utd ground in the Lowry Mall at Salford Quays.  I'd never been there despite working right next door for 9 months!  It's well cool, some great tacky carpet with stars, a big luminous star on the ceiling etc!  Very comfy seats too!  Was a mad dash getting there - it took longer than we thought and we were dying for the loo!  Good of Liz to drive though!
For the first time ever, there are NO entries to display on my friends page!  Eeeeek get posting people!

Well I see the posts have really dried up on here, COME ON PEOPLE!  Having said that I've not helped leaving it 3+ weeks!

I went to the Edinburgh Fringe which was fantastic - will do a detailed post of that at some point!

I'm currently at work, have finished for the day and using the "internet cafe" aka 2 PCs in a corner which we can use to surf the net in breaks, after work etc!  Genius idea!  The job is VERY boring, started 2.5 weeks ago.  I'm in "provisioning" at Pipex the internet service provider, and copy and paste data from various systems to spreadsheets, check things etc.  Really dull but the people are very fun.  Unfortunately, so far, I've not been sat with any of the fun ones so I love breaks etc but the day drags so bad work wise.  Still, it's nice having a sense of freedom in the office, I can have a drink in a cup (Edexcel - sealed flask), can eat at my desk etc!  And never have to use the phone!  Seems incredibly easy work for the money which I like!

Tonight I'm going to see Never Forget, the new Take That musical at the Opera House.  Well excited as it's had good reviews and should be fun.  Going on own as no-one was free to come :-(

Last 2 nights saw 2 awful films for free.  "Kenny" about an Australian portaloo cleaner, supposedly a docu but blatantly contrived and full of dreadful toilet humour (can't believe I hadn't even thought it might be like this!).  I left after 1 hour as couldn't take any more!  Night before I saw "Disturbia" - dire.  Pathetically OTT horror music, stupid plot and just pathetic and awful arrrrrrrrgggghhhh!  Didn't leave early but should have!  Anyway after that the night picked up as I met Nif and Lee in FAB cafe for the superheroes night.  Wasn't actually any different to a normal night but was good to chat geekily!

Had a good but strange pride, weekend just gone.  Each night there was some drinking on the street with various people, some friends, some randoms, some new friends of friends.  That was cool.  Sunday night was the most fun, we went to Hollywood showbar which is my fave, although it was playing crap music already at 1am.  With Heather and Alex.  I was chasing this peroxide blonde Oirish fella most of the night and he wasn't interested.  Very drunk hehe!  In the end I pulled someone else!  

Bands wise it was OK, by far and away the highlight was BETTY BOO!  BOOMANIA was the first album I ever got, for my 6th or 7th birthday, on tape.   I was obsessed with her, even painting a picture at school!  She was ACE live and has gone back to her 1990 look of black PVC and bob!  The Gossip were boring I thought, what a disappointment.  The Sheilas (yes, from the Shelia's wheels ads) were great!  Gareth Gates made me want to slash something or someone - PAINFULLY NIGHTMARISHLY AWFUL AND DRIPPY.  His new stuff is the worst "pop" I have ever heard.  He didn't play any old hits (where the hell was Anyone of Us (Stupid Mistake), his sophomore single and a forgotten classic I'm sure you'll all agree!  Natasha Hamilton (ex Atomic Shitten) was like a strangled kitten.  Nicki French was really good too and did a belting "Total Eclipse of the Heart".  

The parade was the best I've seen - much more inventive than previous years.  Highlights - seeing Andrew in the police section holding the banner; drag queens with big sticky out foam legs and then big penises that squirted water (!) yup shockingly brilliant British tack!  Bear Wash!  Huge pink tank!  It is so genius and I love how because Manc is small it takes over the whole city!  200,000 people came to watch!  

The HIV vigil was very moving again.  Ended with great fireworks and the sad sight of lots of people standing around candles crying.  Brings it all home just how many people are affected by awful illnesses.

Last Thurs went to Liverpool to see Ruth for the night which was cool, we had tea and chatted!  Last Wed went to cinema with Alex, Heather and Nif and saw Waitress (actually PAID to see that, mad I know, but half price with Orange Wed!  After went to Wagamama - they've started doing BOGOF main meals again, every week all summer you can print vouchers and I can print stuff at work!  

Last Mon saw Hallam Foe with Hannah for free at Cornerhouse, it was pretty good but not earth shattering.  Worth a watch, Jamie Bell is good and quite funny.  After she came to mine and we had tea and talked!  Good to catch up!

Weekend of 17-19 Aug I:

- Watched Platform 4 Piccadilly, a free new festival in Picc gardens.  Saw Italian Jugglers, a giant ghetto blaster with cool dancers, a giant Indian drum with cool dancers, cool Bollywood dancers in the fountains etc!  Highlight was a giant ball which floated around all above the gardens, changing colour with an androgynous woman dangling below spinning etc, as it went dark.  Very surreal as everyone was so quiet and it was so refreshing that such a dull concrete boring minimalist nightmare had been transformed into an oasis of fun, culture and good times!  

- Attended the Caribbean carnival in Alexandra Park (Moss Side!) and watched the participants for an hour or so!

- Went home, had meal out with parents, Cath, Het and her new fella Paul.  Then went to local pub on Sat night and we were the last out!  Random and interesting to go to a neighbourhood quiet suburban pub and not an urban or student area one!  Sun had nice quite day hanging out with family.

The weekend before this I went to York on Friday night with Ruth.  Had tea at her family home - Amy and her boyfriend Carl were there too.  Sat AM we set off to Scarborough for the Beached festival - free.  Got to campsite (amazingly nice, right on cliff overlooking sea and on other side the Yorks moors!) and unsurpringly, daredevil driver Ruth knocked the shit shield off her car as she attempted to vault between 2 of these sea cliffs.  Actually it was more mundane than that and involved a 2 hour wait for breakdown service to come and take it off before we could drive again!  

Got to seafront and made our patch on the beach in front of the stage.  All day, the tide kept coming in further and so we kept moving closer!  I wasn't too keen on any of the bands apart from UnkleJam on Sunday, but it was fun to be there soaking in the atmosphere.  Did the obligatory amusements, ice creams, chocolate fountains and chish and fips.  

So that's pretty much it for the past 3 weeks!  As I said I'll do Edinburgh soon!  Got lots of cool stuff coming up - drinks with workmates tomorrow, Get Bent (alternative pride), the New Islington folk festival and filming of the Anthony Cotton show at Granada this weekend - Ruth and Ricki both coming!  

Next weekend Ruth's staying over we're going to the theatre, Art Car parade, a house party and ALTON TOWERS!  Oh yeh!

Soon I'm going camping in Wales for the weekend with Ruth and PRAGUE with Ricki in November (booked flights but not hostel yet!).

Fun times! :-) xxxxx

Off to Derbyshire tomorrow to see Het and parents!  WIll stay til Fri.  One of Het's plays is on so will see that can't wait to see the output of her business!  Excited!

Had great weekend with Ruth.  Been temping for 1st time ever this week - went well and enjoyed being in an office and not being watched like a hawk and timed on loo breaks!

Had interview today for permanent job at a call centre for Pipex a broadband company.  Seemed good should get result soon.  Watched lots of good TV lately as always!

Off home now for a couple of days via CUBE, the Centre For the Urban Built Environment on Portland St to view their current exhibitions which end today.  Then popping to Bolton on way home as I'm becoming addicted to TK Maxx again after visiting Rochdale and Stockport branches this week and getting great bargains!  So going there and to see the old ODEON as it's probably going to be knocked down any day and is an ACE building.  Dragonette were AMAZING last night but only did 7 songs :-( I shook hands with the incredibly sexy guitarist who's the lead singer's hubby!  And he loved my Popjustice T-shirt!
